text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the DUP boycott in Section 4, explaining that their objection was over the continued application of customs checks on goods travelling across the Irish Sea (under the original Protocol) and that the Stormont Brake was part of the political resolution sought by the DUP to gain a democratic safeguard over future EU goods rules.
